metadata.synopsis: Not long after moving into her own place, Maggie (Karyn Dwyer) finds herself with two unsolicited roommates: her recently divorced mother, Lila (Wendy Crewson), and her young brother. The timing is especially bad, considering Maggie has fallen hard for an attractive woman, Kim (Christina Cox), only hours before they move in. What could be a nonissue becomes increasingly complicated -- since Maggie's family is unaware of her sexual orientation, and Maggie is not open to sharing that information.

reviews: Better Than Chocolate depicts the universal humor in the acts of seduction and coupling.
... for those looking for more, they'll have to tell the filmmaking chefs to put something other than Chocolate on the menu.
Anne Wheeler's sexy, funny, poignant film, from a bright script by Peggy Thompson, is a real charmer, with considerable brains.
Plays like a 'very special episode' of a sitcom. That is, one with explicit nudity and sex.
Better Than Chocolate is warm and loving, if not partcularly wise or nuanced.
The makers of gay-themed films often ignore this rule: Romantic comedy clichs don't become innovative just because the lovers are the same sex.
